attributes.comment:
While I see the need for price increases to cover expenses and ensure efficient operations, the
proposed price increases are too dramatic. For example, the cost for an I-485 (register for
permanent status) is currently $325 and would increase to $905, or a 178 percent increase. I can
hardly think of any other good or service that would increase 178 percent in price year over year. I
suggest limiting increases to 25 percent of current levels and applying the increases gradually over
the next five years. Furthermore, the fees should be kept at a reasonable level, in order to
encourage legal immigration and discourage illegal immigration.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Sam Savant
